title: Introduction to Business Intelligence
headline: Learn how business intelligence harnesses data analysis and management to boost profits in this free online course.
description: Are you looking to make better, data-driven decisions for your business or organisation? Do you want to convert large amounts of data into actionable information? If so, you have come to the right place. This course on business intelligence explains how data can be gathered, visualised and analysed to guide decision-making. We examine a range of data-driven business intelligence tools and practices to give you the edge over the competition.
courseDescription:
Does your organisation’s decision-making process lack the necessary tools to convert large volumes of data into meaningful information? This course on business intelligence offers new ways to interpret data. We explore the origins and evolution of the term ‘business intelligence’ before discussing in detail the use of data science and real-time tools to improve business strategic planning.

Modern businesses around the globe are using state-of-the-art technologies and tools available to ensure data is used in the most constructive way possible. We explain information management concepts like data mining, data warehousing and metadata and how these practices can maximise customer satisfaction. After information is gathered, it must be visualised and presented to relevant stakeholders to guide their decisions. We lay out the data management practices that drive this process.

Do you want to master some basic programming languages used for data analysis? We outline the basic concepts and advantages of the programming languages SQL and Python. Proper application of business intelligence principles form a crucial component of almost all successful enterprises today. Sign up for this data science course to learn how to use business intelligence tools to analyse information and make smart managerial decisions.

Start Course Now

• Learning Outcomes
  • Having completed this module you will be able to:
    • Define the term business intelligence along with the key functions and applications that it encompasses.
    • Identify the key advantages of using business intelligence in helping companies make more reasonable decisions.
    • Describe the role of real-time business intelligence and the benefits that it provides in business operations.
    • Discuss the role of business statistics, data science and other related models that are used to make the business function more efficiently.
    • Explain the basics of the programming language called SQL and how it can be used when working with big data.

  • Lesson Summary
  • Below you will find a summary of the key contents covered during the module:
    • Business intelligence is the strategy and planning that is incorporated into any business. The goal of BI is to allow an easy interpretation of large volumes of data. 
    • Business intelligence is most effective when it combines data derived from sources both internal and external to the company in order to make decisions. 
    • Real-time business intelligence is the process of delivering business intelligence or information about business operations as they occur.
    • A Data warehouse appliance is a combination of hardware and software products which were designed exclusively for analytical processing.
    • Data visualisation is the technique used to communicate or present data using graphs charts or dashboards.
    • The cross-industry standard process used for data mining, also known as CRISP-DM, is used by data mining experts and is one of the most popular data mining models.
    • SQL is a widely used programming language that allows you to define and query databases. SQL is a non-procedural programming language.
    • SQL is a special purpose language designed for the creation of data in relational databases.

  • Learning Outcomes
  • Having completed this module you will be able to:
    • Explain what a database management system is along with its key functions and advantages.
    • Identify the key parts that make up the database management system and where database implementation can be appropriate.
    • Analyse the role of data warehousing along with its key applications and functions in an organisation.
    • Discuss the role and importance of data visualisation in current business along with future developments expected in the field.
    • Describe the role the programming language called python can play in the development of applications.

  • Lesson Summary
  • Below you will find a summary of the key content covered during the module:
    • A database management system (DBMS) is a software package designed to define, manipulate, retrieve and manage data in a centralized database.
    • Data Independence is defined as a property of DBMS that helps you to change the Database schema at one level of a database system without requiring you to change the schema at the next higher level.
    • Data models are visual representations of an enterprise's data elements and the connections between them.
    • A data warehouse is the secure electronic storage of information by a business or other organization. The goal of a data warehouse is to create a trove of historical data that can be retrieved and analyzed to provide useful insight into the organization's operations.
    • A data mart is a simple form of data warehouse focused on a single subject or line of business. Metadata acts as a table of contents for data in the DW system, which shows the technique with more details about that data.
    • Data visualization is the representation of data through the use of common graphics, such as charts, plots, infographics, and even animations.
    • Python is an interpreted, object-oriented, high-level programming language with dynamic semantics.
    • Python is now one of the most popular and widely used programming languages in the world. Besides web and software development, Python is used for data analytics, machine learning, and even design.
